Reviews.Title: “It's a okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: jczar
Reviews.Content: So, first off parking. parking is fine because its under ground parking. Check in was a breeze. No problem. Assigned us our room. Get in the room. They said it is all newly renovated. first impression is not bad, but it seems like they rushed the renovation. The floor is so creeky. Very loud. The door handle from the inside is basically falling off. The washroom faucet is not even tighten. The beds are very worn out, does not have the fluff to it anymore. We thought the room was clean until near the end of our stay, we found a used condom behind the bed, but other than that. customer service was great. Very friendly and when we asked for extra towels, it was brought up to us right away. Asked if we wanted to move rooms, for the other concerns, but we were already settled in. If your using this hotel for a overnight hotel because your going to visit the clubs in Toronto, its a bad location. Not even close to the clubs. I personally don't know if i would return here. It was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “any recepcionist did not shout at me all around the world”
Reviews.Author: B T
Reviews.Content: i am travelling all around the world and staying all kind off hotels and beleive that this is the worst hotel i have ever seen. they dont have any room service but they are saying that they have. when you are ill they dont bring you any water and when you are speaking with them they can say shout you easily. also in a night time when your key is broken they can shout you easily too. after you start to take camera he can easily stop shouting and saying sir!! also they can threat you throw out of hotel and even they call the police they cant throw you cause they are not right. and when they are speaking on the phone with police they can easily say lies to police. it happend only 15 mins ago and i am still writing this from my room. if you want to have a nice stay dont choose that terrible hotel in Toronto. you can easily find beter service around.i will try to sue them. i wanted to load the video but it is aroud 20 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bobloguy
Reviews.Content: Was glad that I had chosen the Ramada Plaza for my recent two day stay in Toronto. It's location is close to everything and the price is reasonable. Looking forward to staying next time we are in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: lauren d
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the ramada feb 22 and we got to the hotel a bit early for check in but they let us check in and go to our room anyways. (which other hotels do not, they make you wait) When we checked in the staff were VERY friendly and even upgraded our room to a 1 bedroom suite! The room... WAS GREAT very spacious and loved how you had a living room and dining room and a seperate area for the bedroom and bathroom! I didnt mind paying $22 for parking as it was underground and we were still able to leave our truck there while we walked around toronto all day (after we checked out) When we go back to toronto we will be going to this hotel again! Great experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for crashing on a Saturday!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMikeF
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, once in a renovated room and once in an older one. Both were fine but the renovated one was obviously much nicer! I was very satisfied. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly, location was good and the price was awesome ($100 on a saturday night) Honestly, you can't beat this place in terms of value. However, i do agree it might not be the best place if you're easily scared by the occasional hooker or homeless person as you'll defiantly see this at night. I use to live close by for 4 years so i sort of became immune to it... Random note...if you want ice you have to go to the basement...they don't have an ice dispenser on each floor. Will defiantly come back!

Reviews.Title: “nice location and service”
Reviews.Author: chef-paulo
Reviews.Content: nice hotel,not luxury but well for a couple of days, well located close to dundas square,the parking is 21 dollars a day,so expencive, but good

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromQueensNYC
Reviews.Content: After staying in the Ramada for the first time last winter, I have made it my regular hotel for my frequent Toronto visits. The hotel is clean, comfortable, convenient (506 streetcar is at the corner) and a great value with spacious rooms. I went there a few weeks back and was upgraded to a full suite at no extra charge when my reservation was for a regular room. This will be my home away from home from now on in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Hotel, Great Amenities, Helpful staff, Lacking a few things but Great so far”
Reviews.Author: Satella
Reviews.Content: Had won this hotel thru Priceline for a super nice deal! I read reviews of this place and was very weary of my stay, Nonetheless stayed here the Jan 2012 visit. Its quite far out from city attractions but its a good walk..Outside of the hotel looks nice. When i came inside was very small but warm reception area. Was quickly served and the lounge was very nice with Flat LCD TVs hanging around, a small business centre that i couldn't access with my key card but was in a rush so didn't get a chance to access.. Checking in was a breeze, BUT i was not happy with the $100 deposit fee which took a week to credit back on my card.. The elevator area is right behind reception area and its very small elevators, maybe 5 people can fit into one elevator and it takes quite awhile for one to come down. Theres only 2 elevators! Upon coming off to my room which is the 7th floor theres only 10 floors i think for this hotel. The elevator opened up to a dark yet lit hallway which is nice. The key card entry to my room was nice, when i opened to my room i was very SURPRISED the room was very very spacious! Two queen beds very comfy good sleep. Sitting area with coffee table was great for any guests or a drink. The Closet space was very spacious! I was very impressed with the wash room although it was small it was a walk in shower with glass window open-close type. (Watch your step coming in and out as theres a block height) The soaps,lotions, shampoo had this great scent i couldn't stop smelling them! Very impressed good lighting and also they had this fan in there as well where it sucks up odors which is great, The counter space is very tight n small so be aware of that. Overall the room was spacious and great stay for the night may even stay here during a long weekend i was very impressed!! Free wifi internet access and reliable fast speeds as well is a good amenity. Back to the reception area has a neat little Waterfall window thing which was nice to look at. The access area to the pool was a good walk and the pool was very nice. Wasnt impressed with the changing area tho its old needs renovation. I was surprised to see both a steamroom and sauna in one here! They had a great exercise room with all equipment. Some cons were the carpet was very stained!! needed a super scrub or clean.. They just needed to go!! The desk chair was stained and it looked old needs replacement, Need new pillows although i slept well, the pillows were losing the cotton-feathers or something they were worn out??? Elevators being small and taking long to come around. My key card didnt work to access Business Center the line up at reception was long so i didn't bother to ask. I would definetly rate this hotel Superior if they did something about the carpets and pillows, but overall had a great stay. I have uploaded some pictures from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikekris
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we needed to stay a night in Toronto close to the bus station as we were leaving very early in the morning. It was the cheapest 3-star hotel, so we decided to book it. We were pleasantly surprised when we walked in the hotel and even more surprised when we walked into the room. Everything in our room was practically brand new. We had a room with 2 beds and there was also room for a couch, chair, coffee table, desk, tv, etc... The bathroom was very nice and updated too. One thing about this hotel is the location. In the day time, it is a great spot. It is right around the corner from the old Maple Leaf Gardens and not too far from Dundas Square. As soon as the sun goes down though, it gets sketchy. I saw homeless people sleeping nearby at 8:00 at night and just some scary looking people wandering around. At 5:00am we called a cab and when it pulled up, my wife and 2 kids went outside. In the 3 minutes it took to get into the cab with our bags, we saw 3 hookers. Not suspected hookers, but full out 100% hookers. No doubt about it. So if you're going to be out late (or up very early) with your family, be careful, but if you're a young guy looking for some girls to waste money on, this is the spot! That being said, the hotel is great. There was absolutely nothing wrong with it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever....”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Dec. 27/2011 until Jan.4/2012 for work purposes. I was on a 12hr nightshift and had to try and sleep during the day. This was impossible due to the renovation noises coming from the room beneath mine. When I complained to the front desk about the noise I was blackballed from having my room cleaned, I no longer received any clean towels, and the garbage started to build up in my already dirty room. There were hookers parading around the front door of this place, the carpets were disgusting in this place and the hotel stunk. The staff was unhelpful and in the end just plain unfriendly. I am shocked that this place could not switch my room or better yet....don't book any of the rooms that will be around the renovations.....there were no attemtps to rectify this situation.....a bunch of monkeys could have run this hotel better.....WILL NEVER RECOMMEND THIS PLACE TO ANYONE!!!! This hotel put myself and my co-workers at risk due to the lack of sleep I had while staying here. The company I was working for is relatively large and they heard my complaints as well and will not book rooms here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Hailey M
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful, but didn't seem to keep an eye on much unless you brought it up. We had some very loud, messy, smelly (foreign food) neighbors, yelling and running around in the hallways and playing music loudly. The rooms were average size and relatively clean (but there were long female hairs on the bed, floor, and bathroom). The desk blocks half of the closet doorway. No fridge or microwave. TV was old but had plenty of channels. The beds and pillows were quite comfortable. The room did seem recently updated except for the carpet which had red blotchy stains on it and areas of the floor were uneven and creaky. There was a lot of noise, likely water pipes and also what sounded like a lot of drilling and hammering at about 9am. If you are on a budget and need a place to stay for a night, this would do the job, but do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else if thats not the case!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality”
Reviews.Author: Logan C
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel for the first time and I must say, the front desk was very helpful, check in was quick and smooth, our room was on the 3rd floor, 2 queens, nice sitting area, In all a very nice comfy room that I was able to set my computer up and have internet access. The hotel was close to everything, the night manager and night staff was also very friendly, staff was always very helpful, This hotel had a steam room and sauna so it was a great place to swet out a hangover. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be better”
Reviews.Author: Nicole C
Reviews.Content: The room we had was updated the hallways and room were nice. The carpet in the room was very dirty like stains on it. The parking charge could have been a little less. $22.00 per night is a little steep and if I knew the city better I would have tried to find cheaper parking It was a little loud at night. The room above anytime they walked around or moved around in the bed it was very loud in our room. Overall it was a good stay

Reviews.Title: “shameful”
Reviews.Author: bill r
Reviews.Content: have stayed at the hotel and have had pleasant experiences, but my most recent stay was a nightmare...was harassed by the night shift manager for noise when it wasnt my room causing the disturbance and when trying to explain was hung up on with the front desk and the manager scott was rude and unhelpful, very unprofessional was literally insulted.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED!!!”
Reviews.Author: steph h
Reviews.Content: At first i was excited to stay here because my family stays here all the time, but the lobby first of all had a weird smell, but the room smell was okay, But what was the worst part is we found a bug in our room on the 3rd floor!!! I even got my boyfriend to catch the bug and show them at front desk!! They said we would switch us rooms, but to the 2nd floor where the room was "permanently cold" b/c the ac was broken, and the windows were dirty!! So we stayed on the 3rd floor and they gave us "free" breakfast.. they should of switched us to a nicer room, or gave us another night free, or discount or SOMETHING but they didnt do anything... i took videos of the bug because i was just disgusted... i understand that bugs happen but if they would of done something more for us, but the fact that there was no customer service whatsoever i would advise not to go back or my family to ever again. which is too bad because the rooms and location is decent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Halligan007
Reviews.Content: First off we scored a price of $109 from expedia, so my review is based on that price. Parking was $22 for overnight.... which bugs me because you think it would be free with staying there... but it seems that's how they work it in Toronto for the most part. Anyways the first room we got stunk of cigarette smoke so we asked for another which the front desk staff gave us and apologized. (we have never changed rooms before anywhere). The room was one of the nicest we've stayed in... usually we find cheapest best rated on trip advisor. The only deffect was a broken light switch plate that i'm surprised wasn't replaced($0.50 fix). Bed was super comfy, decor was great. Parking garage was secure. Oh and the only dislike was a worker wheeling a cart down the hallway at 5 or 6am. Overall if we're in this area again and can score the same deal we will foresure stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Location, Price and Room Sizes”
Reviews.Author: ruthlandplace
Reviews.Content: After reading the comments we were a bit concerned, however after getting here we were impressed with the Staff and the rooms. We had a junior suite and it's huge. Yes the carpet may be a bit dirty but over it was a nice room. If you are gay, great hotel close to the gay district.

Reviews.Title: “Good price with upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Oceanbud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada for a short getaway to Toronto. We were very pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade to a 2 bdrm suite from the 2 queen room that we had booked. This really helped us with our 3 kids (23 mths, 5 and 6 yrs old). The staff was very courteous and helpful with questions. Our kids enjoyed the pool which, although not huge, was very clean. The furniture was newer and the bathrooms were freshly renovated; looked great. The carpet needed to be replaced. The subway was not too far. It took our youngest about 7 minutes to toddle over. Would have given 5 stars but for the aging carpet. Hopefully that is next on their renovation list. Very good value for the money. Definitely recommend to other families.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate, far from sites”
Reviews.Author: phillipsrhit
Reviews.Content: We were able to get two queen beds at this hotel; a late booking meant that this was one of the only places left with a 2 queen room, and the rate was decent. Walking to downtown is possible; it takes about 20 minutes. You are about 2 minutes from a street car pick-up, and about 10 minutes to a subway stop. The room was ok, nothing great. Not only did this room has 2 queens, it also had a sofa sleeper, which was a nice bonus we were able to use. We did not eat here. The indoor pool isn't great, but we still were able to take our 3 year old a couple times for some fun. They have a sauna and steam room too, but we didn't use them. Access can be a little tricky with a stroller or wheelchair, but it is possible to get in to this hotel if needed. They do have a parking garage if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: countygirl74
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that I have stayed in this hotel for business. Our rooms were upgraded to a one and two bedroom suites; I have also stayed in the regular guestroom. All of the rooms are spacious (especially for Toronto and the price). The beds are comfortable, rooms clean, although the bathrooms tend to be on the small side. The hotel is old and this is evident if you take the stairs or notice the size of the elevators but we liked the coziness and the character of the building. The staff have always been friendly. The hotel isn't luxurious but is well priced and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Ramada Plaza Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WillinNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from spending six nights on our vacation to Toronto, having stayed at this great hotel. We were very impressed with the hotel... it was in a great location, close to everything downtown... it was very clean, and our room had a great, comfortable king-sized bed. The room size was great as well, and the staff were very pleasant, professional and accomodating! We felt very much at home here, and we will definately return! The price was very competitive as well, by the way :) We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone planning a stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel did not live up to the Trip Advisor Reviews”
Reviews.Author: erinaburns
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel on Monday.Because Toronto was booked up because of the film festival, I had a hard time finding a hotel and finally found this hotel for $177 (including tax) on Otel.com. Before I booked the hotel, I looked at the reviews from Trip Advisor and saw that the hotel had been newly renovated in 2008 and everyone was raving about the remodeled bathrooms. When I arrived, I was given a suite on the 7th floor, but it was right next to the elevator so I asked for a different room. The front desk gave me room 304. It turns out that only 2 floors of this hotel were renovated when I asked why I did not have a remodeled bathroom. Also, the rug could use a good cleaning; there were spots all over it. Finally, the deadbolt on my door was missing. All in all, this hotel could definitely use a makeover and I have no plans to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Red light district!”
Reviews.Author: RedCzarina
Reviews.Content: Pros: friendly staff and nice linens. Cons: This hotel is situated in the red light district. Transvestite prostitutes strut their wares right in front of the hotel's main entrance. There is a park across the street that locals call "Crack Park". Very very seedy. Cons: On Friday and Saturday nights, most of the guests are young adults from the suburbs who come to town to party in the nightclubs. Once the bars close, at 3am, they stumble back to the hotel and make tons of noise hooting in the hallways and partying in their rooms. Imagine bunking with the cast of the Jersey Shore. Good luck sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Toronto..”
Reviews.Author: rocket1974
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel... I have stayed there on many visits over the years. The staff is very professional and very nice to the guests, always trying to do more and suggesting other things to enjoy there.. The rooms have been upgraded with brand new bathrooms in the last few years which are very nice.. the furnishings always comfortable... Always love staying there, not least because of the hotel staff which is great..

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: thenextkristin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a weekend in the spring of 2010 and really liked it. My sister and I decided on the Ramada Plaza because we got a great deal on it and it was within walking distance of the bus station and a few places in Toronto we wanted to see, and it was easy to get around to the rest of the city by public transit. We didn't spend much time in the hotel or take advantage of many of its services, but the front desk staff was polite and efficient. Our room was clean, very nice, and the beds were comfortable. I only remembered complaints about the walls being thin after another guest decided to have a very angry and LOUD phone conversation in the hallway, so hopefully people with no cellphone etiquette aren't regular guests at this hotel. Other than that, I have no complaints. I slept great and wasn't worried about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable, but lacking in customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Youngy1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 10 month old, and had booked a king bed suit. The hotel and room were very clean and tidy, everything was as described. Only fault with the room was the TV, which did not fit the room (was on old box, with everything else being a higher spec). Our stay was very pleasant, however the reception staff were anything but helpful. Check in was difficult and could only be confirmed by the person who booked the reservation. No help was offered with our bags, despite asking for it. We made 3 trips to the room to get everything in, not easy with a small child. On check out I was told to find my own luggage carrier "somewhere in the basement"! 3 more trips!! A pleasant stay, just poor reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dechu2
Reviews.Content: reasonable price for this location. hotel room is bigger and nicer than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: yrussell
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business. It was very comfortable and the bathroom was really nice. I liked the additional sitting room and the nice view out the window. Neighborhood seemed slightly shady at night, but I didn't have any problems.

Reviews.Title: “not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: soardiac
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they offered us a free room upgrade. but that was about the only positive thing when we stayed there. The room was big but very dark, and it smelled horribly (perfume smell probably from air conditioning). Bathroom is nice, but there was only one bath robe even though it was a suite. The restaurant is really terrible, and prices there are still not cheap at all. Also, the only selling machine for drinks was out of order. Desk guys weren't very friendly. One more positive: free WIFI. Over all impression is disappointing! Not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Our second visit - always a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: hpstrawberries
Reviews.Content: For our family with two children under six, we had a junior suite. A fold-out couch in the sitting area was fine for the kids, and a comfortable king-size bed gave us a place to relax at the end of the day. The connecting door is glass; a great feature for young kids who maybe don't want to lose sight of mom & dad while in a strange place. Supper at the hotel restaurant was fantastic; high quality, reasonably priced, and excellent service. Breakfast was disappointing - there are lots of diner options within a block of the hotel and it's worth the walk to leave. The pool is very small but good for young kids, as it's very shallow (only 4 feet at the deepest part). The desk staff were always friendly, very helpful, and loved answering our kids' questions. They treated the whole family with courtesy & respect. Next time we're in Toronto we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Happytravelin33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 1 night. He was there on business...I tagged along! We had one of the mini suites at the end of the hall. The bathroom was really nice - lots of towels, clean, recently renovated. The main sitting room was good - it had a microwave, fridge and coffee maker. The bed was super comfortable. I had a great sleep. Location - I liked the location, there was lots of restaurants around, there was a subway station close by, walking to the Eaton's center took me 10-15 minutes and 35 minutes to walk to Roger's Center (the Skydome). My husband ate in the restaurant at the hotel and said that it was really good. My only complaint (and it isn't that big) - I didn't find the front desk guys to be so friendly. Good stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MBC300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ramada for an overnight n July 2011. The hotel has been around for quite a while but some of the floors have been nicely updated with decor and furnishings. We had an end unit (mini-suite) that was nice and quiet The un-renovated floors are not recommended. Underground overnight parking is expensive at 24.95. Helpful staff, reasonably clean ... good value

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TOfrequentflyer
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Ramada Plaza. The rooms are trendy, very spacious & comfortable. We love the updated bathrooms & the tributes to Toronto displayed in the artwork on the walls. The staff is helpful & friendly, parking is a breeze & the amenities are perfect for a quick stay in the city. We compare rates before every visit to TO but the Ramada keeps us coming back., great value for our dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: catherine176
Reviews.Content: Pros: We were fortunate to get a very spacious room - 2 queen beds and a pullout couch in the sitting area- perfect for 2 adults and 2 toddlers. The bathroom sink area was kind of small but it was very clean served its purpose. Beds were very comfortable and the blankets and pillows were great! Front desk was friendly and helpful. A short 7 minute walk to downtown Toronto. Cons: No microwave and the carpets were visibly stained.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: willy_wonk123
Reviews.Content: we were fortunate enough to have a great room that was very large with two double beds, a work desk as well as a living room area. Everything was clean and the beds were very comfortable. Bathroom was a bit on the small side

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: bondi2544
Reviews.Content: I went with my family for a long week-end and we really enjoyed the hotel. Clean, with a good location, close to CN tower and the harbor. I would return!

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: niki1300
Reviews.Content: This property is alright. It is clean but a bit dated. If you are just looking for a place to crash at the end of night, it is a good place. Not a place to stay as a couple if you are looking for a romantic getaway

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Great location”
Reviews.Author: martina08
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, for a wedding downtown. Overall, I'd stay here again. The room was clean, the staff were friendly, the location was close to many things. We walked a lot of places - and there's a tram stop just outside the hotel. My only complaint is that the shower-head was very low.... it was a little strange - but definitely nothing to prevent another stay. I didn't try the pool or restaurant so I can't comment on that - except to say the menu prices looked reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “A New Low!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff001
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels both reasonably priced and more expensive. I have NEVER stayed at one as poorly run as the Ramada Plaza. The room was barely passable for cleanliness and when I reported it the front desk staff were smug and rude. The whole feel of the hotel was outdated and I, too, as the last reviewer wrote found hair in the bathtub and a few when I pulled the bedsheets down. The area is very sketchy especially at night. There are far better choices. Ramada needs to pull the manager and put a better one in because the potential for this place could be there with proper management.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: woodproducts
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip overnight the last weekend of May. My secretary booked a room for me and when I got there the room was not very clean. I found hair in both the bathtub and sink and there was an unpleasant smell of mold. The staff are very young and really don't care about service. Their attitude was flippant and bordering on rude. The area this hotel is in is central but is in the middle of hooker alley. My friend had once told me never to stay here but I didn't convey that to my secretary when she booked it. Stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Well Appointed "Boutique Style" Hotel, Clean, Close to Attractions, Economical”
Reviews.Author: tripsterhipster73
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous to stay at a "chain" hotel in a big ciy centre, but was pleasantly surprized with the location, staff and modern feel to the spacious room. We had friends drop by for drinks and the spacious living room allowed us to entertain with the luxury of a seperate room for sleeping. No downside to this deal! A great find that I will use on my next visit. A short walk to shopping and theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced, decent location”
Reviews.Author: runawayvespa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced, for Toronto standards. The room was large, clean and comfortable. The wifi was fast. The bed was comfortable and there were no signs of bedbugs. The room we were first given smelt like smoke and we were immediately moved across the hall when we requested it. After changing rooms our access cards stopped working each day and we had to constantly ask the front desk to reprogram them. The tv also didn't work, we had to ask for it to be fixed. The largest downside was the noise. We were constantly awoken by people entering and exiting their rooms late at night. I had to ask the people in the adjoining room to shop shouting at 3am. The hotel is being renovated and there was construction noise during the day. We weren't in the room much during the day, so it wasn't a problem. The parking was over priced, at $22 a day plus tax, but it was secure and convenient. There isn't much around, it's a five minute walk to the subway and we had to go searching for restaurants. The park across the street was pretty, with plenty of cute dogs and squirrels running around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: aly068
Reviews.Content: My family and I were in Toronto over March break and stayed at the Ramada Plaza. It is the first time that I stayed at that property and was pleasantly surprised. I have two teenage sons so the location was excellent. Almost everything was within walking distance. The hotel staff were very helpful in recommending things we could do. The rooms were quite large and very comfortable, especially the beds. I would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone. I feel that we got excellent value for what we paid and we will definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: jair2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza recently and was very disappointed. The hotel itself is dated and awkward to get into by car. Their parking is on the side of the building but the entrance is in the front with a thin staircase. I took notice that a person in a wheelchair would have accessibility issues. Before I was in the front door I was accosted by two prostitutes asking if I wanted company. After checking in I went to my room and found that it was not thoroughly cleaned. The washroom floor was sticky, the full-length mirror had not been cleaned for a while, the drawers of the dresser needed vacuuming and the worst was the head board and picture above were covered in stains that I will not be specific about. Because it was late when I got in I slept but the next morning asked the front desk to do a more thorough cleaning.The clerk was flippant in his attitude. This was not done when I returned to my room at 12:30 PM. (the room had not been made up at all yet). When it was finally done the stains on the headboard and art above the bed were still there. There are better choices in the city for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves”
Reviews.Author: maddy13318
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed the Ramada Plaza Hotel, the rooms were a bit small as were the bathrooms but the beds were comfortable, the style was modern and it was very clean! The services wasn't great but it wasn't bad. I would have booked again since the price was decent and the location was great however after checking out and getting home, while unpacking I realized I left 2 rings on the bedside table in our room. Knowing exactly where they were I called the hotel and they put me on hold for 15 minutes.. I had to call back to speak with someone again and re explain the situation and their reply to me was "we'll have someone look later today". Later today? Have someone look now. Well I called and harrassed a few more times and they finally sent someone up and to my suprise the rings apparently were no longer there. The rings themselves aren't of a huge value but they were expensive enough and I had just recieved the the weekend before for my 20th birthday from my parents and was actually at the hotel to celebrate my birthday with my friends. I am very disheartened and disappointed that someone felt the need to "claim" them for themsleves. I have been to mexico and left rings out for days with room service coming in and out and NEVER had a prblem and those people are dirt poor, and yet a civilized hotel in toronto cant keep their sticky fingers to themselves. Very disappointed in the situation and the help I recieved during the situation. Wouldnt recomend this hotel to anyone with valuables. (They dont offer a safe in the more "conservative" rooms to protect your valuables either)!

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: SomeGirl
Reviews.Content: Almost terrible, but not quite. Just old. And worn out. And tired. Fine for one night I guess. One elevator didn't seem like enough; it's barely large enough for the housekeeping lady and her cart. The room was set up with 2 queens, a couch, chair, coffee table, large dresser, desk and desk chair... too much furniture for the size of the room and everything was ill placed. You couldn't open the dresser drawers fully because the bed was in the way. You couldn't open the closet door without banging into the desk. Really strange. Sort of like they just chucked in all the pieces they could, or that didn't fit in any other rooms. Bathroom was basic and old. So, basically old. Didn't shower there. Hallways smelled. Carpet was gross. Parking garage smelled like urine. Lovely. Parking is actually $25 after tax. Only real upside was property forgotten in room was prompted mailed back to me. That was a welcome surprise. And the bed was comfy. I wouldn't chose to stay there again. Paid $70 through Priceline. I'll up my criteria to 3+ next time I visit Toronto. There must be better deals than this place.

Reviews.Title: “We are rebooked for 3rd time... Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeachTimmins
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have just rebooked for 2 nights. We find it very convient to get to our Dr's appt at the hospitals. We have always been very happy with our rooms, always clean, very spacious, never an odour. Beds are the best for sleeping, excellent mattress, down duvet & down pillows, terry housecoats in closet. Furniture is high quality. Staff are always very pleasant, go out of their way to make sure everything is to Your liking. Free highspeed internet is a bonus. In Sept we stayed at a hotel just a couple of blocks south of the hotel. We paid $20.00 a night for internet and $40.00 a night for parking (plus taxes). $22.00 for safe underground parking is worth it in downtown Toronto. Very nice, clean, reasonable priced restaurant on site. Shopping & restaurants on same block. We are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay at a cheap hotel.”
Reviews.Author: superLwoman
Reviews.Content: At 60 dollars a night at this hotel it was a great stay in downtown Toronto. Only problem with this hotel is the bad smell from the hallways and the rooms. But for 60 dollars night that smell can be overlooked. Also, if you can avoid parking a car at this hotel, try to. Parking is 22 bucks not including parking.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms, Helpful staff, free wifi, great value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Marahsk
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Free wifi throughout the hotel is great! The price is a great value for downtown Toronto. The hotel is convenient to restaurants, attractions, and other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Toronto Hotel for Price”
Reviews.Author: Zann11
Reviews.Content: Toronto is expensive and you generally don't get much for your dollar when it comes to hotels. This hotel is the exception. It is a bit off the beaten path downtown, but well worth the 5 min walk to the main strip at Yonge/College. The rooms are very spacious with updated decor. The beds are high quality and very comfortable. The room was clean. One negative - I had a 2 bedroom suite and the bathroom was too small for such a large space. The bathroom also needs to be updated...the door didn't close and was very old. Be prepared to pay $20+ for parking, but that is pretty standard in Toronto. Overall, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Very Impressing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skinnnie_minnie
Reviews.Content: The Service was great we need to have some more stuff and when we asked for it, we got it. The staff couldnt do enough for us, they were awesome, any questions or anything we needed they got or got someone to get it for us. I told them that I go down quiet abit to Toronto and that if they could give me good rates, that I would book there on a regular basis. The room we had was great, I was very impressed it had lots of room, very clean and the beds were so comfortable. The location of the Hotel is not to far from the Eaton Center and close to downtown and area hospitals, so if you have to go to any of the hospitals is about a 10 minute walk. If you need or want a place to stay I would highly recommend this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Smelly. Yucky.”
Reviews.Author: Tortor_4
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice now for work conferences. First time was put in a suite and it wasn't so bad, but this time the smell was noticeable everywhere...old, smoky, dingy. The carpets in the regular rooms, both mine and my colleague's, were filthy, stained and disgusting. Tried to plug in my laptop in an outlet behind the night table and the floor back there was covered in years worth of filth. I would have left if I hadn't had to stay for the conference. Both myself and my colleague felt allergies from staying here. And the bathrooms are in major need of renovation as well. Looked like a prison bathroom. Problems in both rooms adjusting the heat setting as well. Bad.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like urine”
Reviews.Author: conmeister
Reviews.Content: Expensive paid parking not included with room rate. Parked and tried to exit the parking garage through a green door marked exit. Found ourselves trapped in a urine smelling stairwell. No door knobs on the inside. Had to exit through an alarmed door after walking up and down 4 flights checking each exit. Desk staff told us that we were supposed to use the purple exit door. Huh? Stayed on the 7th floor. The tiny elevator door opened and closed so quickly we also got trapped on it and it smelled of urine. Exited into the 7th floor timewarp. Ancient dirty carpet in the hallways that guess what.... smelled of urine. the room was okay but carpet was old and bathroom was tiny and needed a thorough scrub. Had a brown coating on everthing from the floor to the heater to the light switch. One of the two beds was fine, the other had a visible canoe shaped mattress. Ice machine in the basement. Creeeeeeepy! Good news, no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Overlaid
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference for four days over a weekend. The lobby is smart and large, and all of the desk staff were extremely helpful, allowing me to check in early (and check out late) without question. The room was large, although a bit dark. Had a view of the building next door (where the pool is, which wasn't that hard to find). Excellent location, near the village and a short walk to shopping on Yonge Street. If you're not lazy you can walk to the ROM. The room, and the lobby were spotlessly clean. Parking was plentiful and the charges were not out of line with the area. Judging by the sign on the door, this was formerly the Essex Park Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough”
Reviews.Author: cheap_cheerful7
Reviews.Content: Ok...although I was here for a very brief stay of 2 nights..there are some things that I thought needed addressing..the lobby area..and please feel free to correct me if I'm wrong..but saying that the lobby is 100% handicapped accessible may be true but to a fault...wheelchair entrance access is to the side of the building after the step(s) up entrance on Jarvis Street and it brings you, not through the main doors, which are located inside the small driveway leading to the parking area, where I take it would be the drop off / pick up area if arriving by car, but through a small door which leads to the front desk ..then you need to circumnavigate the elevator area going past the restaurant where there is one of those wall mounted electric sliding chairs to take you down 3 or 4 steps to the level of where the elevator is..I find that tricky..and what exactly is the wheelchair individual to do with their luggage ..I honestly don't recall seeing any bellmen around to help with same.. there is a sign that tells you to request assistance if you need to use the chair.. and even for the able bodied..I think it's annoying that you have to step down ( 3 or 4 steps ) from the front desk area to get to the elevators, lugging your bags while you do this as there is no ramp for you to roll down same from the check in desk to the elevator..the same thing goes for getting to the underground parking..even if you took the elevator to the basement or parking level..you still have to haul bags down some stairs before exiting into parking area...and even at the drop off / pick up entrance...no ramp to wheel bags up when you get out of the car..you have to lift your bags up some steps to the main entrance, and I came with some heavy bags as this was the last hotel stay of my 10 day vacation in TO...The room which was a King bedroom suite was great..oddly enough the heater was on, in early October ?? and figuring out how to set the thermostat to get cool air was challenging but eventually solved with help from a front desk staff member ( Michael ? thanks for your help ) ..the downfall for me was going into the bathroom and under the face basin was a bottle of Rest Easy bed bug spray.. $9.99 if anybody needs to get one..I don't think I really needed to see that to be reminded that there still might be some creepy crawlies hanging around...The hotel itself is in a great location..just across from it is Allan Gardens which is a lovely green oasis in the middle of all the buildings, visit the conservatory if you get chance..beautiful tropical plants etc..and in walking distance to core downtown area..Yonge Street , Eaton Centre, the subway, etc. On weekends it could be busy with folks coming to spend the weekend downtown..I was there for Nuit Blanche..as were some definite party people staying on the same floor but noise was not a problem...out the hotel and right go past the nearby convenience store..I guess conevnient in winter but I would walk further down the block to the nearby Rabba..better selection of stuff to get..like a small supermarket..out the hotel and turn left and a few blocks up towards Bloor street , but not that far up , you've got the Keg steakhouse, and some other place whose name I can't recall, across from it that was good if you wanted to eat breakfast outside the Hotel...I think on corner of Jarvis and Cawthra Square ??..I appreciate that the Hotel is a heritage building so there are limitations with what can be done, like the 2 small elevators,,really they can't hold 4 people with luggage, but I think there are a few considerations that would improve the overall experience of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “What a depressing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LondonDavidUK
Reviews.Content: We had booked a standard room - which we stayed in for one night - as we'd booked our whole stay of five nights over the internet and there was no possibility of a refund we stayed the remaining four nights but upgraded at extra cost to a small suite. The first room was dark and not particularly clean but worst of all it faced a building site (where work will clearly be going on for several months). Even through the closed window the noise from the site was disturbing early in the morning. The suite was on a higher floor and was on the other side of the building - the room was brighter and more pleasant. Again cleanliness was an issue - it was just acceptable. Towels in the room were old and worn. The towels provided for use at the pool were threadbare. The pool itself was very disappointing - just deep enough for an adult to swim in at the 'deep' end. The location wasn't bad, a street car stop was very close and a metro station just a few minutes walk away. The bleach scented reception area was clean and bright but I'm afraid that cannot be said for the rest of the hotel. If we had not been committed to paying for five nights we would only have stayed for one. The staff were ok - they were happy to store our luggage as we had a late flight on our last day. We didn't enjoy staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCanadaAli
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a terrible part of town. The carpets were stained horribly. The room spelt of cigarettes, even though they claimed to be a smoking free hotel. The swimming pool & parking were in a different building and weren't easily to get to. To sum it up: dirty, old, bugs, in general a horrible experience.Plus, we couldn't get the internet to work. I'm shocked that this hotel was a Ramada!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves Higher Ranking than 48th of 117 hotels”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGourmet99
Reviews.Content: Very good value: good location, clean & spacious rooms. In spite of what other reviewers said the elevators are fine (except for the need to negotiate a few steps). On the weekend there was some noise from partyers, but it didn't last too long. The staff was solicitous and competent: burned out light bulb fixed quickly; extra towels appeared within 5 minutes of a phone call to desk. Breakfast in restaurant was very good, and not expensive. While the charge for parking was high, it was not high for Toronto and they provide unlimited in/out for the daily fee.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience never return!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PortElginJesse123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel, the weekend of the 27th of August. The night was fine but the issue I had came on the morning I went to get my car from their parking garage. An individual(later found to be their employee) hit my car in there underground parking lot and did not report it. We needed cameras to find her. She said she would pay for the damages once the quotes were sent to her. This wasnt the case as she just complained of the cost and would not pay. The only thing I could do is file through insurance which I did. Throughout the process none of the employees offered to repay us the extra $20 I payed to park there or repay us for our room as one of there employees wrecked my property on their premises. What poor customer service, everyone I talk to about this is disgusted and cant believe they treat their guests like this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: FamilyMan715
Reviews.Content: The place was very comfortable. We were extremely pleased and satisfied with the room and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Not Suitable for Families on Weekends”
Reviews.Author: VAFamilyof5_10
Reviews.Content: As soon as the weekend hit, starting Fri afternoon, the twenty and thirty-somethings starting arriving staying many to a room. They were loud and partied in their rooms instead of going out (sad really). Bad for families with kids. To top it off, our vehicle was vandalized (a hockey magnet stolen off the back). Elevators were difficult to navigate, too small, too crowded for families and suitcases. Walking downtown was an experience. If you don't go down the right street you can run into the adult section, not many family restaurants within walking distance and on site only opens after 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “COMPLETELY UNSUITABLE FOR BUSINESS TRAVELLER”
Reviews.Author: BeccyLee
Reviews.Content: Where to start?! I was booked in for seven nights but booked out after a couple of nights stay. Upon entering the lobby you are confronted by the overpowering smell of chlorine, which remained throughout my stay ... odd, because the swimming pool is located in a seperate building. Incidentally the pool is 3feet deep at the shallow end and 4 feet deep at the 'deep' end. The corridors/hallways and rooms all smell heavily of stale vacuum cleaners and are extremely dark. My room was dark and whilst relatively clean and tidy on closer inspection only receive a daily surface clean. Skirting boards, bathroom tiles, light switches etc. were all covered in a layer of black grime and my shower had a window in it overlooking a building site (hello boys!). There is a single restaurant, which is more like a cafe/diner and is open only for breakfast & dinner. And, as I found out on my final eveninig the hotel is located in the heart of Toronto's small but active red light district. I am a woman travelling alone on business - there was nowhere in the hotel that was suitable for me to sit with a glass of wine, laptop, newspaper, book etc. This hotel caters successfully for tour buses who require only a cheap & cheerful evening meal, somewhere to lay their head, quick breakfast in the morning before getting back on the bus. After a couple of nights of sitting alone in my dark, smelly, dirty room I stopped being so British (don't make a fuss) and checked into The Grand located two blocks south on Jarvis & Dundas. For $30ca a night more I had a beautiful, light, clean, bright suite. A professional gym, a pool with a deep end, a roof terrace with hot tubs and a hotel bar/restaurant/patio where I could sit happily and safely chatting to staff & patrons with a glass of chilled chardonnay, Toronto's finest sushi and a mouth watering restaurant menu.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at the Right Price”
Reviews.Author: rustyjdcs
Reviews.Content: We selected the Ramada for a combination of location and price. The Ramada was easy to get to, the staff was friendly and helpful and the rooms were clean with ample space. We got a Jr Suite and it was just the right size. There is a restuarant right in the hotel plus a pool, hot tub, fitness center, squash courts and a business center. Everything was spotless clean. The pool was smallish but just fine for a 3 year old. There was a problem with the hot tub that had the water too hot to tolerate without becoming soup. Also, there were no bell hops so you have to get a cart and bring in your own bags. There are certainly higher quality hotels with all of the top of the line ameneties and a location to die for, but all this comes at a cost. The Ramada was just right for me and my family -- it was clean, quiet, roomy and the staff was pleasant and helpful. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let poor looks deceive you”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: RECOMMENDED. I will dispense with the 'bad' first. This property is located in a less than stellar Toronto neighborhood amongst various homeless people wandering about. It's also 3 long blocks to the nearest metro and there is little by way of nightlife nearby. The hotel itself is older and bit worn on the edges, 2 small elevators work the 10 floors. Sounds all bad? The hotel has been slowly renovating itself. Rooms are large, clean and in general good repair. Renovated baths are nicely fitted and brightly illuminated. No room to room noise and zero street noise. Bedding is comfortable. Linens and towels good. Working desk area with free Internet access (reasonable speeds). Staff was not overly friendly, but responsive to any requests. Toronto is a safe city and while the neighborhood is a tad iffy, it's plenty safe and I was never concerned returning late at night. Overall, I was a bit nervous entering the property, but my fears were unwarranted. Ask for a renovated room and you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: bodycheck99
Reviews.Content: My mom and I were in Toronto due to my dad having surgery and we needed a room at short notice. I have stayed in Toronto many times but all surrounding hotels had no available rooms. We entered the Ramada and all they only had suites left. The staff were very pleasant and accomodating and let us have the room at a reduced rate . The building is old but well maintained , modernized and clean. They had a nice flat screen TV in the room. The room was very spacious and comfy. The restraunt was also a great suprise as we had a great meal for a fair price (enjoyed it more then our meals at the hard rock

Reviews.Title: “this place is almost to good to be true”
Reviews.Author: newcomeroo7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the festival and found the stay and the servive wonderful we ate in the shade restaurant and even meet the Chef what an incredable person and his food was a 3 thumbs up from all of us great work chef Keith cheers see you next carrabean week'nd ny

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Elikali
Reviews.Content: This was our first â€“ and likely last â€“ experience with a Ramada hotel. Travelling with two toddlers and staying in Toronto for only one night, we chose this hotel for the convenient location, the large 2-bedroom suite configuration at a reasonable rate ($290/night, including the parking fee) and the comments about this place being a family-friendly hotel. Upon arrival, we are told that our suite isnâ€™t ready yet. â€œPlease come back in an hourâ€�. An hour and fifteen minutes later we are told â€“ after some confusion at the reception desk - that a new suite would have to be cleaned for us and to â€œplease come back in another hourâ€�. We are now well past the check-in time of 15:00. The toddlers are exhausted from a long drive, we need to change diapers and refresh, and we only have that afternoon/evening to enjoy the city. So we are not very happy to have to wait another hour. The front desk personnel is friendly and seems genuinely sorry for the confusion and inconvenience but is also somewhat ineffective or inexperienced. We ask to store our baggage while we try to keep the kids distracted for another hour. This takes several minutes because the staff keeps being diverted by other requests (phone calls, questions, a guest whoâ€™s looking for his taxi to the airport, etcâ€¦) Finally in our suite, we are pleased with its size and configuration. There is, however, an old, musty smell and the rooms/bathroom are somewhat worn. We discover that half the lamps, the microwave oven, 2 TVs and the coffee maker donâ€™t work. We need to prepare the milk bottle for our youngest so we call the reception and ask if someone could come help us out. â€œProbably a breaker that has tripped. Weâ€™re sending someone right awayâ€�. No one ever came. Around 22:00 we asked the reception not to bother sending someone up as the kids were already asleep. â€œSorry, weâ€™ll send someone first thing tomorrow morningâ€�. Of course no one came the next morning either. We checked out around 9:30 the next morning. Check out was fast â€“ no one bothered to ask us how our stay was. So here is our feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: pjpdelaware
Reviews.Content: We reached Canada safely and found this hotel and Canda itself to be so beautiful. We had time to try the pool and it was relaxing and simply rejuvenating. The hotel was very clean and the checkin people were so nice. Wonderful 2 day stay. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, if you get a good deal”
Reviews.Author: Pakatika
Reviews.Content: Service at this Hotel is really not good. It is a gray, depressing building, the rooms are dark and in winter either too hot or too cold. Although spacious, you do not feel comfortable. Maybe it is just before renovation, but the entire atmosphere is terrible. The fact that some wallpaper show watermarks doesnÂ´t help either. If you get a good deal it can be worth staying in the center of town, otherwise do not expect to get more than a clean bed to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about, but a good stay!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveller060
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza while attending a birthday party in Toronto. It was a great location, minus all the construction going on. We had a nice room, and had no noise complaints. My only issue with the hotel is the height of the shower heads in the bathroom. I'm not that tall (5'5"), the shower head was too low. I had to tilt my head back in order to get my head under it. Other than that, it served it's purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy dirty hotel which needs a good clean”
Reviews.Author: NAF2010
Reviews.Content: Although the room size was good, this hotel was absolutely filthy. Although its only a 15 minute walk from the shopping centre, its not a walk you want to do at night as a female on your own! This is a problem if you want to eat in the evening, because the restaurant is awful. There is no-one in it (not surprising) and the food served all comes deep fried. I can not recommend this hotel less. Try the Sheraton Centre, which is nearly the same price and a million times better. I actually switched mid stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: TizzieBelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights over Easter. We had the king suite which had a living room and separate bedroom - although the decor is dreary and dull the rooms are fit for purpose. They provide a fridge and a microwave and a small dinette with chairs. It was nice to have the extra space and I didnt think the room was overpriced at $139 a night. unfortunately the hotel did not inform us that the restaurant would be closed for catering as it was Easter - however, there is a supermarket - turn right out of the hotel and walk for 5 mins - 24 hr supermarket (Rabba supermarket?) Avoid the convenience store right outside the hotel as it is way overpriced and the supermarket is only a few mins furhter down the road. if you turn left out of the hotel and walk for 15 mins there is a pub restaurant called the grand hive - nice food and service. There is a Keg steakhouse on the opposite side of the road (turn left and 10 mins walk) the big bus tour trips collect right outside the hotel. Parking cost is atrocious so we parked overnight 5 mins walk away in a public car park for $4 (hotel is $25 a night plus tax). overall nice hotel -

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but dirty.”
Reviews.Author: erinmary
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to Toronto for a bachelorette party. We reserved a two bedroom suite at the Ramada. The room was spacious, and served our purpose. But it was very dirty. The rug was stained and had not been vacuumed for a long time, as evident by the food crumbs all over the floor. We probably will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel location and value”
Reviews.Author: Abboodie
Reviews.Content: If you visit Torornto and you want an affordable, nice ,clean and convenientely located, Ramada Plaza downtown is the answer

Reviews.Title: “Awful service”
Reviews.Author: bethany88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a hotel with some girlfriends this past weekend. Service was TERRIBLE!!!! Also, the walls in this hotel must be paper thin. We received a noise complaint for watching Seinfeld in our room. On another occasion we received complaints for TALKING in our room (and were threatened to be escorted from the hotel by police). Staff were rude, unfriendly, and very unwelcoming. Unless you are willing to have your room cleaned at 8am it isn't done. As I was traveling with a group of young females I can only assume we were being treated so poorly because of our age. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone....By far worst hotel I have stayed at EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: irving86
Reviews.Content: During our stay with Ramada we thought the room was spacious, clean, and beautiful. We were quite pleased with how friendly and pleasent the front desk staff were. We thought the hotel was very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: Lax1818
Reviews.Content: I've now stayed here twice since the New Year. It has become my "go to" spot while in the City. It is a little North, but is easy walking distance to the Entertainment District, and the subway is just around the corner. I stay in the city about twice a month, and this is the best combination of facilities, service, and staff I'm yet to come across. The rooms are large, with a lounge, and on my last visit they put me in a newer room which had a glass and ceramic, shower, as well as a modern toilette and a pedastal sink. It has a squash court(though bring your own equipment if possible, there's sucks!!) a pool, hot tub, sauna, and I think steam room. As well as secure, on-site, underground parking.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay for price!”
Reviews.Author: BCoCoPuff
Reviews.Content: I recently spent my valentines day and family day with my gf at this hotel in the 1 king bedroom suite and I must say it was exactly what was expected, amazing. Website pictures were identical, very clean, friendly staff. Only downfall was underground parking (22$ + tax) and that the washroom area was cold but I'm sure I could've got that resolved if I really wanted. Great value for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat satisfied”
Reviews.Author: AngeleRick
Reviews.Content: Hotel room (King Suite) was spacious & bed was extremely comfortable. Room & hotel however could be cleaner & the pool was too cold. Staff was great & location of the hotel ideal. Price of room was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A good option if all you are going to do is sleep at the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: faycandice
Reviews.Content: Ideal location - close to all major downtown Toronto attractions. The lobby is nicely renovated but the elevator and hallways are very old and dingy looking and have a stained, dirty feel about them. The rooms have been re-vamped and modernized a bit but the washrooms were old and dingy. Was woken up several times throughout the night by other hotel guests walking around outside and being loud in the hallways. All in all - a good option, if all you are going to do is sleep at the hotel and spend the rest of your time exploring the sites nearby.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: manglalakbay
Reviews.Content: Had fun. Pool is conveniently located. Nice location in toronto and close to shopping. Friendly staff. Nice rooms but old bathroom that needs remodeling.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: One of the few englishmen left!
Reviews.Title: “5 star reception Staff--go out of their way to help!”
Reviews.Author: thequiet0ne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for around 6 days, and every day were very happy indeed at the ambience of thw place. Situated a stone's throw from the main drags such as Eaton Centre, College Park, and the longest street in N America, Yonge St. A little further, but still walkable in about 25mins (we did it in a temp. of around -23C!!) is Spadina Ave, home of Chinatown and CN Tower. If there is one slightly moot point, I would say that they could do with an bigger business centre (basically a room where you can access the net and print out your docs etc)--the present space only has 1 PC and if it is being used when you come down, you have to wait your turn). I could have avoided the wait by bringing my own laptop but couldnt be bothered to lug it around! Another bad point is the restaurant--the menu is spartan and has a knocked-together-last-night feel and the waiting Staff of 1 is not really adequate, but we were the only ones there anyway! We ate at other restaurants nearby, within walking distance again. Being from Europe, my credit card failed to go through their system, which had me almost peeing my pants with worry, but the Staff were very cool about it and said I could pay in cash, which is rarelt done at hotels I've been to. The room was very clean indeed, with fresh, crisp and clean bed linen, clean bathroom etc. One of the cleaning staff was a bit surly but hey, with a job like that, who wouldnt be! All in all, a very nice hotel, which we will be using the next time we go down there.

Reviews.Title: “Close to downtown shopping”
Reviews.Author: Rhea1983
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Ramada over three nights, used mainly as base camp for Niagara Falls NYE celebrations. We arrived at the Ramada late at night and I found the staff member to be cold and uninviting. There are only two lifts servicing the entire hotel and one was broken on second day we stayed there. Our room had 2 Queen beds, and a sofa bed which were all very comfortable. Bathroom: the shower recess was dirty and mouldy and was not sure if the floor has been wiped or mopped during the daily room service. We even saw one of the housekeepers blowing her nose onto the bed sheets as we walked past another room. WiFi was weak and annoying slow. Location: is fantastic, only a few blocks to the Eaton Centre which is a large shopping centre with most well-known brands. Wristbands were required for re-entry into the hotel after midnight on NYE - once again we were let down by the staff when they yelled "WRISTBANDS!!" at us as we walked into the hotel...how hard is it to ask politely?

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: neela10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you are planning to host a gathering of underage party animals or looking to bring some professional talent to your room. The hallway noise was bad when we called the front desk, but hotel security must have joined-in because the party only grew louder. By 3:00 am the party was in full uproar and there was no staff to be seen or heard. This hotel is out of control and the desk staff is indifferent. Do yourself a favor and find a safer place to spend your money.

Reviews.Title: “Upsetting”
Reviews.Author: brenaricks
Reviews.Content: I rated this hotel very poor, because it smelled of cigarettes, I think from another room, but was not sure where it was from. My husband, myself, my son and his friend stayed for 5 nights. I enjoyed staying in the downtown area. Although, I did not expect to stay in such a bad hotel. You were charged for everything and that made the value, not a value at all. With the poor quality bath towels to the prosititutes at the front entry. The worst.

Reviews.Title: “Needs soundproofing!!”
Reviews.Author: Parislove97
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, it was nicely decorated, had spacious rooms, was very clean. The restaurant was very nice and not too expensive. Beds were comfortable, the shower/tub was very nice. However, a big problem for me was the sound. I am not a light sleeper, I sleep through horrible storms usually. But I had a big problem here. My first night, something woke me up at 3am and then the people way down the hall who were talking a little louder than usual kept me awake all night. They really weren't being that loud, but I could hear them so well in my room that it was a problem. The second night, I was woken up a few times by people just walking through the halls talking - it sounded like my door was wide open. Other than that, it's a beautiful hotel in a pretty good neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great price”
Reviews.Author: Liz00
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto with work and chose the Ramada because it was a much cheaper option to where the conference was. The room was great and very clean with all the facilities I needed - perfect. The location was fine - near to all shops and about a 20 minute walk to the front. The only down side was the swimming pool - it seemed so quiet I was scared to use it and the gym could do with a bit of an upgrade - but that's me being fussy - it had runners and was always quiet so I had it to myself on most occasions! Other than that, staff were really friendly and helpful - I would definately reccomend this hotel to others looking for quality at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Jeni8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and staff all very friendly. I stayed one night in a regular room. The room was clean but a bit dated. They had done some recent renos but it seemed a quick job. One very odd thing about the room was that the TV was situated in a cabinet with doors that limited the view from the sides and as a result could not be seen from anywhere in the room but directly in front. There was a small sofa in front of the TV which was ok but it was terribly annoying that I could not see the TV from the bed. Internet access was hit and miss.. and quite slow. Overall the room was a good size with a generous desk area. The location is close to the downtown core but there are some sketchy areas nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great size room for families”
Reviews.Author: Lemonie
Reviews.Content: Well I have to say we were very pleased with our two night stay at the Ramada in downtown Toronto. It can be quite hard to find a hotel room for 5, our room was very spacious and all the beds were extremely comfortable. The room itself was decorated well, room was a little dark and the bathroom needed to be updated. The hotel was a 10-15 min walk from the main downtown area, where Eaton Place, Hard Rock cafe etc is but our children managed it with no problem. It is about a 45 min walk to CN Tower, we caught the subway which was very easy and cheap. We did walk back from ROM/Chinatown area which took about an hour but as a tourist that is a nice thing to do. Car park facilities at the Ramada are excellent. We arrived 11am on the day of check in and parked straight away in the hotel multistorey, we had the space until 6pm the following day all for $22, a bargain! Hotel easy to find. If you don't mind staying a little out of the main area for a cheap price, then I would recommend this hotel. We would return, the hotel was full and we heard that many had returned.

Reviews.Title: “There was nothing really wrong but...”
Reviews.Author: kenyonmartin2003
Reviews.Content: The good points: 1. Suite. Two bedrooms with a living room. Perfect for a family traveling with three children. 2. Front desk was very nice. 3. Indoor pool. A travel must for us. The bad: 1. Its really not close to anything. Its a $15 cab ride each way. 2. The neighborhood -- while safe, Im told, is not all that appealing. 3. Paying for parking irks me -- but its the reality. 4. The rooms are dated and somewhat dingy. The bedding feels new -- although not sure it is. I guess its all about the price. For us, with this amount of room it was great. Its not convenient really -- and Im not as enthusiastic as the others who have written but its ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: michaelaltose
Reviews.Content: Clean, large King Suite with fridge and microwave and eating area. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Good location close to a lot of downtown attractions. The park across the street is a little seedy but I wouldn't let that deter me from staying here or even from walking around at night, although I would stay on the west side of the street at night. Underground garage parking is a nice touch although it's $22 + tax per night. The fitness center has 2 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, stationary bikes, and some weights. There is a nice little indoor pool also with a sauna, whirlpool, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, great room!”
Reviews.Author: NathDC
Reviews.Content: After 12 hours of traveling with 2 young children (2 and 4 years old), we were so happy to finally arrive at our hotel. We had booked a double room, but we were told we could also have a suite for a small supplementary cost, so that's what we did. The suite was just great! 2 big rooms, a nice living room and a small but clean bathroom, what more could we ask for? One thing we didn't really like was the Shade restaurant. It was supposed to be very good, but we were all alone, it was cold due to too much airco and we got all courses one right after the other, it felt like we had to leave asap! Too bad, but we would definitely go back to Ramada Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: LDuck
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little way out of the city centre, but within walking distance of most attractions, and certainly had good public transport links. The staff were helpful, and we were upgraded to a suite on arrival, which was lovely. The suite was spotless and was a lovely place to return to after sight-seeing. The restaurant was handy and the breakfast menu had plenty of choice. The staff here were also friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a hidden gem!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah1903
Reviews.Content: We stumpled upon this hotel accidentally and it was the best accident ever!!! We were in disbelief when booking as the cost didn't seem right. We thought, on no what are we getting ourselves into.....we arrived and were blown away!!! We stayed for 2 nites, in the two bedroom suite. This suite was the largest room I have ever seen! It had 2 large bedrooms, spacious sitting area/business area, individual climate control in each room, and the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on away from home, microwave, fridge and the list goes on! The rooms, hallways, lobby, pool area were all VERY, VERY clean. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Parking was in a secure underground garage that was very cost effective for downtown ($22.00CAD/nite). We had a beautiful view of the park from our suite and had no problems with the area. Very close to all downtown ammenities. Will definately be staying there on our next trip to Toronto. Only negative comment would be don't shop at the convience store across from the hotel entrance, very expensive and some items were past the best before dates!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RS637
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend and had a King Bed Suite. The room was great. Spacious and clean. The service was great. We needed extra towels and had no problem getting them. The room was cleaned within a couple of hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CAtravel07
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant about booking this hotel because we've never been in this area of Toronto before, and previous reviews have pointed out the presence of some..unwanted people in the vicinity. But we got a great deal for the week and booked it, and we're glad we did! The hotel was great. We arrived at midnight, and were very pleasantly greeted with news that we would be upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite! The service was great (though you do have to ask for a luggage cart and roll it out the back ramp yourself. The main entrances are all stairs.), and the room, though itself bit old, was spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable!! And the decor was very nice and modern. Bathroom of the suite was a nice size, and even the sofa bed was okay. I do have on complaint, and that was it was very easy to hear the people next door and people slamming the stariwell doors because we were right next to the stairs. The people next door were being very loud, and it was very easy to hear exactly what they were saying in on the of suite bedrooms... What I found was that this area is not somewhere I would feel comfortable to walk around by myself at night. However, during the day, we had no problem whatsoever walking to and from Yonge Street (very short walk), and walking right down the street to Tim Hortons. Yes, there are some homeless people occasionally approaching you and yes, we did see one prostitute near the hotel when we first arrived, but that in no way spoiled our trip. We felt very very safe within the hotel, and again during the day, there was no problem at all. If location is one thing keeping you from booking this hotel, I would tell you to book it for its proximity to downtown attractions and its value. (Be advised: they lock the underground parking garage at 12AM until 6AM, so you will need to wait for a worker to open the door if you plan on getting to your car during those hours. Safe, but for night owls, inconvenient.) The Ramada was located just a few blocks from Yonge Street, and we walked there 3 of the 6 days we stayed, and were able to walk all the way up to Bloor, to and down Queens (amazing and unique little stores), and Chinatown was within walking distance. St. Lawrence Market was also right down Jarvis Street, and I highly suggest you plan a day to visit it (so much fresh and unique food!!). This hotel is a GREAT location if you want to be close to the action, but not pay too much for being right on Yonge or smack dab in the middle of that area. Overall, this hotel was a great choice, and we would definitely return with our family! PS. Free wireless internet made my trip. It's a great connection, easy to access, and...it's free!

Reviews.Title: “We went to Toronto to visit old friends and ended a perfect visit at the Ramada.”
Reviews.Author: DrBarb
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive about our trip to Toronto. My husband doesn't like driving in large metropolitan areas and in addition to that we didn't know where we were going! Amazingly, we found Toronto to be an easy city in which to find one's way around and we made our way to a public parking lot a few blocks from our friends' apartment. But where to stay. Our friends recommended the Ramada, just three blocks from their apartment, and what did we know? We made a reservation. After a wonderful visit, dinner, and more visiting we checked into your hotel. The room was spacious, modern, and very clean. The entire hotel area was very clean including the below-ground parking area. This is definitely where we will stay the next time we visit our friends! We did have a less than pleasant surprise upon checking out. We found that we were charged extra for parking. For the cost of parking we might have been given at least one compliementary breakfast. But all-in-all, we'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: DutchJournalist
