Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a short walk from the subway, on a comfortable spot if you are coming by car. In the later afternoon and evening there are a lot of junkies/homeless hanging around in the park across Jarvis, so you might want to stay on the 'good' side of the street. The hotel itself is a bit tired, but the rooms are nicely decorated. I got a free upgrade to a suite, which was very spacious and nicely decorated - the standard room i saw was looking good as well. The (free) wifi works very poorly, which is annoying. Good location if you don't want to spend a fortune and don't want to be in the buzzing centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay !!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysontheroad67
Reviews.Content: We had to be in Toronto for business and booked a king room online. When we arrived we were told that they upgraded us to a King Suite !! Great big space, very quiet and comfortable. Very clean and up-to-date. The price was unbeatable and the service was first class. We ordered dinner from the hotel restaurant, which was excellent. Bye the way the suite had a nice dining area with very comfy chairs. I would stay there again any day.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place”
Reviews.Author: Meson
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Inn was a decent hotel thats not too far from a subway station. We didnt get to explore the neighborhood too much, but it looked like it was a good area. It's fairly close to Toronto's gay neighborhood and the theater district. The rooms were big, we staying in the two queen room. Beds were comfortable, couch wasnt so much. The bathrooms are a little small and outdated, but they served the purpose. Hi-Speed wireless internet was available and worked for us with no problem. There is also ample parking in the parking garage, and is comparable to what other hotels in town charge for self parking. Room service was efficient, but the food wasn't anything to get excited about. Not the best menu selection either. Overall a good place to stay, price was reasonable - but we got it on a special.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Tranen
Reviews.Content: Had room 702 and 704 for 3 nights, for a bargain price of 79 CAD a night. One of the rooms was very smelly when we checked in, so we notified the staff about it, and when we got back again it was fixed. Convinient garage on site, 25 CAD a night, which we wasnt informed about untill check out, but still, we needed a place to park the car during our stay :) Would definately stay again for that price, and the rooms was very roomy. Bathroom a little bit cramped, but we still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “central location and large room”
Reviews.Author: sobeit3
Reviews.Content: this room was the biggest i have ever stayed in for the price. 2 queen beds, and a living area with couch and easy chair. beds firm and comfy. stayed 5 nights to avoid sleeping on my mother's floor! i got the cheapest rate, about 100 canadian a night, and it was very good value. yes the bathroom is small but the tub was deep and brand new. that is all i care about! i asked for a lower level room away from street and that is what i got. no fridge though, maybe in more expensive rooms, but restaurant downstairs kept my leftovers in their fridge! and yes, restaurant is convenient, there is a Tim Horton's on corner too. right across from a nice park and gardens. yes this is an area with many homeless persons, but news flash, it's not the only area of TO that homeless persons frequent. i checked out the sauna and steam room, great temperature but stean room needs updating. whirlpool not hot, but you could probably get them to reset temp. shallow pool. the workout room looks great, all new equipment. these things are in another part of the building, so at first i felt a little nervous alone. best to go with a friend. oh yes, housekeeping was done everyday, even if i had the 'do not disturb' sign on till 1 or 2 pm. that was great! oh, and if you are a woman looking for a spa in TO check out Blitz spa/waters...amazing pool, sauna, steam in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Would Return”
Reviews.Author: Stevenme
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The room was adequate and I enjoyed the linens on the bed. We found the room clean and the staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. We will probably be in Toronto in the near future and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Tigger112233
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The room was absolutely massive! And the bed was the most comfortable bed iv ever slept in! Paid hardly anything for 2 nights and was shocked at what we got for our moeny, such a big room! The bathroom was clean but a bit old fashioned and i had to shower on my knees at the shower head was so low. The only downfull was that if anyone was talking in the corridor outside, you could hear them quite loudly but generally it was pretty quiet. The location was excellent a short minute walk from the eaton centre and central toronto. The staff were friendly and helpful! Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value right in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Tunetina
Reviews.Content: The renovation was completed in summer in 2008. Very good value for the price & location. A streetcar stop is just around the corner and the closest subway " College " is within a reasonable walking distance. The room was clean but some bathroom facilities are dated as if it was an oversight by the renovation crew. I was worried about a week-end crowd in terms of the noise, but that didn't happen. My only complaint is that I had to call Data Valet ( the hotel's IP ) three times during my four-day stay to get decent wireless connection. But to be fair, it seems rather difficult to get a stable wireless connection in any hotel if it is free. If you are out all day for business, this hotel will serve your purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: stpoint
Reviews.Content: This is a strange hotel to rate, there is nothing to really dislike about the hotel but it needs improvements. Firstly, the hotel has no guest laundry and the secondly the rooms have no fridges. we stayed for 3 days and both of those facilities would have made me give the room a higher rating. The room was comfortable enough but furniture/TV was dated but functioned OK. The bathroom was tiny. Room was cleaned really well during our stay. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The pool/spa/gym were good. As I said if the hotel had fridges and a guest laundry I would have rated it higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and rooms”
Reviews.Author: shap2
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise, booking the Ramada Plaza for the less expensive option for seven women, and discovering really great rooms with plush, very comfortable beds and a large enough size to gather with a group. The bathrooms are a bit small, but both that and the room were kept very clean. The heating and cooling was very efficient. We enjoyed everything from our check-in/check-out to our breakfast in the hotel restaurant (I recommend the French toast which is served with lots of fresh fruit). Parking was only about $20.00 a day and that was less than most hotels downtown, plus you could come and go as often as you pleased without having to get an attendant. The front desk was always helpful and had good suggestions. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good value for price”
Reviews.Author: WYW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in Oct 2008. We were upgraded to a 1 bed suite (rm 1012) upon check in. The hallways are very dated which did not give a good impression. However we were pleasantly surprised by how modern and clean looking the bedroom and living room were. However there was an awful smell (almost like cigarette smoke or a musty smell) in the suite (I bought an air freshener which managed to mask the smell). My fault and I can't complain as I should have called down to reception to report the smell. The bathroom was a little dated. The bathroom floor was not particularly clean and had a number of hairs visible (and in the bath tub). Overall the whole suite was very dark and the lighting did not help. Facilities: Living Rm: flat screen tv, free internet access, coffee making facilities, desk, comfortable sofas. Bedroom: TV, comfortable king size bed. Location: Walking distance of most sights, shopping, restaurants. The area was not the best and we didn't feel comfortable walking back to the hotel in the evenings and got taxis back at night time. We had breakfast on our last day and there was only 1 waiter working in the restaurant...needless to say he looked very harassed. However he was very pleasant and did an excellent job of making sure all the patrons were fed.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: daver1
Reviews.Content: Simply put... an excellent deal for a hotel downtown in Toronto. We were skeptical at first, but pleasantly surprised. The hotel has been refurbished, and quite honestly should be much more expensive based on the rooms size and furnishings. The beds were comfortable, the room also had a pull out sofa bed so could really sleep 6. The furnishings were great and very non-hotel looking. The only drawback was the bathroom, which was a bit small, but I could not rate this hotel down as the pluses more than outweighed the negatives. We'd stay there again in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: markEurope
Reviews.Content: very pleasant hotel with a good price/quality balance. Clean and spacious rooms with good beds. Quiet area though still close to all the action. Easy to reach from Toronto Pearson airport: take the "express shuttle bus" for 18CAN$ to Delta Chelsea and from there it is a safe 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected; comfortable, good value.”
Reviews.Author: alMossah
Reviews.Content: We required one double room and a twin room for ourselves and our two grown up children, visiting from the UK for 4 days. This seemed to be one of the few hotels which did twin rooms. The whole experience was exactly what we wanted and expected from reading the reviews and studying the hotel's website. The rooms were excellent sizes, the bill was exactly what we expected, the staff were helpful. The hotel looks very shabby from the outside, but inside it is fine. The beds were all very comfortable. Our suite had a small fridge and coffee machine in, enabling us to keep wine and beers cool. Breakfast was OK, but not inspiring; there's a great breakfast place one block away (Daybreak) which we recommend. Overall, we'd recommend it, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “huge suites”
Reviews.Author: stumpytcat
Reviews.Content: a huge suite, as big as some flats ive lived in!!!! good location, a short safe walk from younge street,and oposite a small park. the pool was a tad shallow, but if thats all you can fault in a hotel..... my son had the misfortune of needing a dentist and the staff were excellent in helping us with this

Reviews.Title: “Ramada!!! Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: MartaZanchi
Reviews.Content: Goood location!!!! The bedroom was fantastic, very comfortable beds, lots of space. The location is good too, the hotel is front of a beautifull park, and you can go on foot easier to downtown, to St. Lawrence Market and City Hall. very good staff! Two problems: The windows do not open and doesnt have a refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: showmethedeals
Reviews.Content: We stay here when our daughter has an appointment at Sick Kids Hospital. They are always very accommodating and give us a great hospital rate! The rooms are very clean and the staff friendly! It is a great location, easy to get to the hospital and other locations in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “lots of space”
Reviews.Author: soprano9
Reviews.Content: Great location for a spot only two blocks from Younge street. The lobby was clean,along with a spacious restaurant that served a great breakfast for a great price. The standard room was huge offering two queen beds with a sitting area,desk area,along with an adequate bathroom facility. We made use of the pool and hot tub that was so much fun to languish in after a long drive. All staff was very professional and offered assistance when required. I would definitely stay at this location again!

Reviews.Title: “It was "ok"...”
Reviews.Author: KitKat003
Reviews.Content: After checking the net we found this hotel for a decent price. We did request one of the "new" rooms and got it. It was ok, the bathroom on the other hand was small. When I checked in I found the gentleman behind the counter rude. Twice I had to ask him about the parking since he talked to fast and seemed in no mood to answer my questions. So I sent my husband down once we got into the room, he had no trouble... Took the kids to the pool, if you call it that. It is small, good enough for a dip I guess. It looked a little green around the sides, needs to be cleaned. With all that said, if you want a good price hotel that is in a good location, then this will do. We were able to walk to mostly everything downtown, including Roger's Center, CN tower and so on. Just don't expect a five star hotel with this one, but it will do for a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisw03
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel a couple of block away from everything. It is a nice budget hotel, it had a pull-out sofa which is nice. The only bad thing was the size of the bathroom. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Colpoy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ramada Plaza for three nights in late February 2008. We were in Toronto on a four-day weekend to enjoy a Raptors basketball game. Overall, the Ramada Plaza was a great value for the money and I would stay there again. Here are some comments I have about our stay: - We asked for and got one of the recently renovated rooms. This meant new carpet and furniture in the main room, with a clean modern feel (and firm but comfortable king size bed). Don't expect perfection here, but for the money it was a nice change from outdated, faded and worn furnishings that you'll see in most other downtown hotels with that price range. - As mentioned in other reviews, the bathroom only received a minor upgrade and still shows its age (e.g., older walpaper, dirty tiles, old baseboard heater). That said, everything functioned well and aside from aesthetics, the bathroom was fine. Of course, one has to keep in mind that the hotel is over 75 years old. - We never had a problem waiting for either of the two elevators. - Front desk staff, which rotated throughout our stay) ranged from bearable to excellent. As an example, when we checked in the staff processed us quickly but without much interest. In stark contrast, the next day, we where served wtih a big smile and keen interest by another staff member when we had to report a minor problem...which brings me to my next comment. - Given the age of the building, the floors creak a bit (no problem there - gives it some character), but the walls are also quite thin. Our room was next to the Housekeeping closet, so we frequently heard cleaning carts crashing about (although the cleaning staff were very nice). More importantly, there was a large group of female students (about 19 years old) staying in a group of rooms on our floor and other floors in the hotel. The only problem was that they girls were yelling, laughing and even crying in the hallways until after 1am and starting again at 7am. As I mentioned, the front desk handled this well and things improved, but we realized there will always be a fair amount of noise that you can hear in your room through the hallway walls, etc. I was glad I had packed some earplugs! I've stayed in a fair number of hotels and haven't had this problem before to this extent. (BTW, we found out later that the girls were were on a school trip to Toronto for the weekend to learn "responsibility" lol) - Parking is very convenient, but a little expensive. - It was easy to get to the College subway station about a five to ten minute walk west on Carlton St. to Yonge St. On Saturday and Sunday you can use a Day Pass for $9, good for 2 adults, on the subway, street cars, buses, etc. - There's a Golden Griddle 24 hour restaurant closeby on Carleton St. near Yonge St., which we took advantage of since breakfast was not included with our room. - Allan Gardens are directly across Jarvis St. from the hotel. This classically proportioned Victorian park features a beautiful old 1909 glass-domed greenhouse and some interesting varieties of plants from cacti to tropical plants to rare types of tulips, etc. Plus, it's free! - We didn't see any prostitutes or homless people during our stay. as other people have said in their reviews. However, we were usually back in the hotel fairly early (e.g, 11pm). - The hotel has very good rates for a downtown hotel. If you can take advantage of their "government rates" then you'll save even more. - We have stayed before at the Days Inn hotel on Carleton St., not far from the Ramada. I liked the Ramada better because of its lower room rates, newer furnishings, smaller size, plus the age of the building gives it a bit more character. - Note that renovations are still ongoing at the hotel. We saw some brickwork being cleaned up on the front of the hotel, and we saw a shipment of new window and floor furnishings arriving when we checked out. I don't think either of these renovations should be disruptive to guests. So, despite the noise problem, we liked our stay at the Ramada Plaza and plan to return for our next trip to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Professionnal”
Reviews.Author: Audan
Reviews.Content: We loved it; Very good service. Employees were helpful and smily.

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: buddha1
Reviews.Content: Rather misrepresented. Apparently the entire hotel is non-smoking. Not a problem....but I should have been informed 4 weeks ago when I booked a smoking room. The suite I booked had " a love seat and a pullout sofa bed" --check the website. I have a two seater love seat and a desk chair in the living room. Fine...unless you plan to have meetings in your room or watch television. The television is unviewable from the single sofa......when I asked for chairs in my room to match the website, I was delivered several "banquet chairs". Not advertised, not acceptable. I understand the place is pretty cheap...buit misleading advertising is unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: rrcquebec
Reviews.Content: The Ramada was clean and the staff was friendly and courteous. I had a very spacious room and a comfortable bed. The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of downtown TO. I enjoyed my stay there very much!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah2626
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terribly disapointing. There was broken glass on several floors within the suite and a lamp in the bedroom had been burnt leaving a mark on it and the floor along with the smell of burnt fabric in the room. When I made this aware to the receptionist he refused to make eye contact with me and barely acknolwledged my complaint. The suite we booked contained none of the facilites we expected. There was a fridge that appeared not to work and a microwave but no cuttlery or glasses. This place was so bad that we cancelled the last night of our stay. Itâ€™s not terribly expensive but the dÃ©cor, facilites and service were well below par!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EdwardNoble
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location at least 10 times over the past few years and am always very pleased. It is now newly renovated. Location is the Best, very central between uptown & downtown. Prices are quite reasonable AND they have very good Room Service plus free wireless internet and in room pay movies when bored. There is a fair gym which I use. The indoor pool I don't bother with . . . but the kids seem to love it. You can't beat the value for the location. Edward Las Vegas, NV

Reviews.Title: “In Love With The Ramada!! No Better Hotel Out There!”
Reviews.Author: bobz786
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Ramada Plaza Toronto, as always, was very courteous and polite. The hotel itself is situated in the perfect spot downtown Toronto, and the rates are unbeatable. The rooms are spacious and clean, and the overall stay was extremely pleasant. I would reccomend the Ramada to any individuals looking for a pleasant hotel experience. Thanks again for such a wonderful stay, I look forward to my next visit which will be very soon!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice......”
Reviews.Author: draculaUlverston
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the plaza with my 12 year old daughter we enjoyed our visit to toronto and the hotel was located perfectly for shopping and all the sights...we found the restaurant served lovely breakfasts and dinner and thanks to Eri she really is super efficient,the room was big and very comfy. cleaned every day so if your in toronto and want a nice and politely run hotel you really should visit the Plaza......my daughter and i loved toronto its just an amazing city in a beautiful country i wish i was there right now....nik and poppy.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: sandeman215
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel every year for the past seven years and have come to know the hotel and staff very well over this time. It is consistently above average and has benefited this year from a makeover to many of the rooms. The suites are large and comfortable with all the services you would expect from a Toronto city centre hotel including secure parking. It is close to the "PATH" famous for its underground shopping and all the major downtown attractions and is well placed for the waterfront and Toronto Island. The service is extremely good. The staff are friendly, efficient and very helpful, especially in the restaurant which is large and airy and a comfortable place in which to eat either beakfast or dinner. There is a swimming pool, whirlpool and sauna or steam room in which to relax together with a newly renovated exercise room. We will continue to visit Toronto and the Ramada Plaza. We are always made to feel welcome and at home and would recommend it highly to all travellers whether on business or vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: ewss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We chose it based on its location and price. Overall it was a good value. The room was clean, well decorated and the staff was helpful. The only drawbacks were the small bathroom and the parking fee. We felt that the fee was quite high ($18/day). We would recommend this place for anyone looking for a nice, reasonably priced place to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: aeroplanram
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located near the subway eliminating the need for a car. The room was spacious and clean. The staff were very patient and accomodating. The experience resulted in a repeat booking for the Grey Cup. kingstonvic

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was fine, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Royb67
Reviews.Content: Was a bit worried after reading the reviews on here but pleased to say that we had a good stay at this hotel. The staff on reception were always friendly and helpful, recommending some great restaurants (try The Keg on Jarvis for a great steak and La Cabana on the Danforth for a good Mexican). The hotel is well located for most of the sights, streetcars and the subway. The area was ok but I agree with some of the comments about after dark. We walked south down Jarvis one night and came across some dubious characters although didn't experience anything untoward. If you avoid Jarvis southbound after dark, the rest of the area is fine. We had a large room on the 7th floor that was clean, with two great queen size beds that were really comfortable. The bathroom is small but modern and fully functional with a great shower. Tried the pool which is small but ok for a quick dip. Overall, would stay here again due to location, friendly staff and great value for money .

Reviews.Title: “Good location, fair price”
Reviews.Author: compressorman
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel when staying downtown Toronto as it is only a few blocks away from the heart of the City (e.g. Yonge Street, restaurants, event), is more reasonably priced than most downtown hotels, offers safe underground parking, and offers everything needed for the business traveller (restaurant, pool, Internet, proximity to a metro station etc.). There is nothing exceptional about the hotel, but in essence it offers excellent value given its location. I have stayed there many times over the last 7 years.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: fubnj
Reviews.Content: The hotel was cheap, but not in a great location, and the room could have done with a refurb (and I'm sure it had recently had one, so I should say a better one). On arrival, we had to cart bags up some stairs, so limited level access as far as I could see, which wasn't too great. We had problems of an embarassing nature with the bathroom, which were sorted out, and then realised we didn't have enough towels or crockery for us all. The room itself was a suite, and from the floorplan, the largest room in the hotel. 2 large bedrooms, with a lounge and bathroom. Plenty of space for luggage and clothes. There was a smelly microwave and intermittently-working minifridge. The coffee wasn't wonderful either. The bathroom was small and old, and once the issues were resolved was OK, but could do with a refit. The fridge stopped working and when we investigated this was because there were too many appliances all working off the same electric socket - bit risky!! The windows needed cleaning too. The beds were king size, but not too comfortable. There were three TVs overall (one in lounge and one in each room). The area in which the hotel is located is not the best but ok. The Carlton streetcar is nearby, and College subway station not too far away either. Allan Gardens has improved in recent years since my last visit, but still isn't great. There is a swimming pool, which we didn't try ,and a restaurant that looked decent value, but didn't try it either. Quite good facilities for the price though. On departure, they tried to charge us for 3 nights car parking, when the car was returned to the hire company after the first night (and we told them so at check in and when we returned the car). They did keep our bags in the luggage room on departure day so that we could do some last minute shopping, which was good. Overall, average - the room was very big and decent value at Â£200 for 3 nights for what was really like an apartment, but could do with a refit and I wasn't too keen on the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: alexzandriajohnson
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the hotel! The staff were friendly and the room was great! We loved the location and we're going to stay there again this weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior98
Reviews.Content: Regular guest at this hotel. Well located, good parking, large non-smoking rooms. Overall cleanliness is excellent. Helpful staff at front desk. Breakfast is quite good. Have not had dinner in the dining room yet. Reserve ahead, they are frequently booked solid!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: atkinsc
Reviews.Content: We are so sorry we stayed here. We do not feel that we got value for our money. Hotel room had a very tired look, though the lobby and pool area were very well kept. If you are hoping to do sightseeing pick a more central location. I must agree with other reviewers, the parking cost is a bit high considering the location of the hotel. I am sure the hotel management will respond with a comparison to other more centrally located areas(which wouldn't make for a true comparison) but we found that public parking downtown actually offered more competitive rates. After two nights here we left and went to the Fairmont Royal York and had the best stay. This is NOT the place you want to take your family for a nice Toronto stay. While it is not the worst hotel, it is certainly not among the best. After reading the hotel management responses we should have been more suspicious. Despite what management says to defend itself I am genuinely suggesting you pick another hotel if you have that option.

Reviews.Title: “Consider Ramada as your LAST option”
Reviews.Author: TheLalalala
Reviews.Content: Before I arrived in Toronto, I booked the Ramada Plaza based on the good reviews that were listed. I took the negative ones with a pinch of salt. When I arrived at the hotel, I realised I made a HUGE mistake not taking heed of the negative feedback which have proven to be true. First impression of the hotel is, the frontdesk staff were very indifferent to me - their guest. I commented that as there are so many steps leading up the main door and exit of the hotel, they need to have a staff to assist guests with heavy luggages. They plainly told me Ramada Plaza do not have any staff like that or any bell boys. When I stepped into the room at the 2nd level allotted to me I was terribly disappointed at the old and aged state of the rooms, and the small space of the toilets. the toilet sits very close to the bathtub (2 inches away), and the window beside the bathtub is about the size of a 15inch laptop. Upon request to change to another room on the higher level, once again, I was shocked to find that the drainage of the sink and the bathtub were not working. I found a pool of water collecting at my feet up to my calves while showering. The water in the sink did not drain quickly, but seeped down slowly. The space was small. I do not know about the other good reviews about how spacious the suites can be, but my room was definitely not conveniently laid out. I felt that they should just remove the tv area, and expand it to a one bedroom space. I saw and experience these in a room that was newly renovated (as conveyed to me by the frontdesk when I told them what I experienced). My goodness - they do need another round of renovation. The hotel housekeeping were nice, but I would not say that of the attitude of the frontdesk staff on duty then. My advice, you can find much better hotels than this at similar rates. If you are looking for comfort to stay at this hotel for more than 2 days... forget it. If you are there to stay on a tight budget for 1 or 2 days... it is still bearable. Please reconsider this hotel. Too bad, I was too distraught to take any photos of the hotel rooms at this hotel. The situation outside the hotel in the later evening is not really a nice place to walk. There are people on crack, and prostitutes lurking around. I do not know if it happens for 1 or 2 nights, but I was long gone to another hotel, and did not stay at Ramada for the 7 nites that I had initially planned. I left after staying 1 nite.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suite”
Reviews.Author: afasd
Reviews.Content: Suites are spacious, excellent for families. Highly recommend as alternative to regular hotel rooms. Suites are clean and nicely decorated. Unfortunately the swimming pool is not amazing ie. only 4 feet deep.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mommzy
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ramada Plaza in Toronto while there for a medical appt. The staff was very friendly, helpful and courteous. We were upgraded to a wonderful suite and no extra charge and we wish we could have taken better advantage of it! It was beautiful! We have stayed there a few times before, love the hot tub and plan to stay there again when next in Toronto. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from it”
Reviews.Author: franhuer
Reviews.Content: Have tons of money? like to be chargerd 18 dollars daily for parking your car?, use the guest's computer, not to have internet in your room? dirty carpets? very expensive restaurant? have the toilet 2 inches away from the shower tub? (if you are a man, you will know what am I talking about... Then go to this very expensive, Ugly and close to nothing hotel... better go to a Hotel near the airport.. by the way.. if you are renting a car.. do not use Payless... their office is 5 miles away from the airport, so you will not be able to drop the car and take the plane..you will loose one afternoon returning the car and spending 50 dollar to get back to your hotel and another 50 in the morning to go to airport. Office is in an obscure corner of Renassaince Hotel, no signs, very depriment place.. employees are rude, can not speak english properly.. and hide prices of rent.. stay away from Payless rent car and Ramada Plaza Hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Honest, honorable, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: ginaqueenpoet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ramada Plaza while I was attending the Toronto Film Festival. To begin with, I was impressed with the kindness of the desk staff, particularly Abdul, who was always happy to call a cab for me, because I found it difficult to get one on the street. He was friendly and helpful. Most importantly, I was AMAZED by the HONESTY, KINDNESS, AND HONORABLE HOUSEKEEPING STAFF. There are two people I need to mention first: PAULETTE BOWERBANK AND MARIO who went beyond the call of duty. Paulette found my cosmetic bag, which had a very valuable piece of jewelry and immediately brought it to housekeeping, where it remained until I called. In the past, when I or others have left something of value in a hotel, it disappeared or was reported lost. This piece of jewelry (an antique anniversary ring) is one of my most valuable pieces, so I wasn't hopeful (I told my husband that there would be a 1% chance for me to recover my ring, so you can imagine my surprise when Paulette told me they had the ring). I actually cried when she told me that she had the ring. I was so touched by her honesty and ethics. I rarely experience this kind of goodness --- and have never experienced it at a hotel. I also have to say that everyone on staff was friendly, helpful, hard working, and respectful. I also want to thank JILL CHICO, a manager at the hotel, who is going out of her way to mail me my jewelry. I am so deeply touched by the kindness of these people to whom I am forever indebted. My room was large, spacious, and clean. I will be returning to Toronto for the film festival every year and I will always stay at the Ramada Plaza. THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rates, recent "designer" upgrades a plus”
Reviews.Author: Peewee13
Reviews.Content: Reasonable rates coupled with "designer" upgrades make this a god stay. New carpet, wall treatments and light fixtures are an improvement. The mini suites are great if you have visitors or want your own space. Fairly quiet rooms. Bathrooms could do with additional upgrades. Small elevators. A litle bit of a walk to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “good service”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLA
Reviews.Content: Had a few disturbed nights with noisey neighbours but were moved when we complained. Also a disturbed night when plastic sheeting at front of hotel where builders were carrying out work flapped against window. Again we were moved this time to newly updated super clean and modern rooms at quiet end of hotel. Shame we didn't get these rooms to start and good job we were on an 8 night stay. However service was fantastic all round hotel. Pool ,gym, resturant all great well worth having breakfast and eating in on an evening. Super manager on duty during our stay made our stay great.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: kpb1968
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every week and the service and experience is always a pleasant one. For my work the hotel is located in the heart of it all. If there is an issue it is resolved right away. George is my favorite front desk person as he is ever so helpful and easy on the eyes too ;-)

Reviews.Title: “the good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: trinilogger
Reviews.Content: My family - 2 adults and two kids 15 and 11, booked a 2 bedroom suite for 8 nights. We missed our connecting flight out of miami and tried calling the hotel all night long and never got an answer. Our room was waiting for us when we arrived though. Very spacious and comfortable for four persons. But we couldn't get rid of the awful, dank stuffy smell. One bottle of Febreeze and one can our aerosol later and still nothing doing. So the following day we asked to be moved. The move was courteous and swift. The second room was a newly renovated one and much better. Aftre that everything went smoothly. However, after we left we discovered that two small paintings which we were carrying as a wedding present had been forgotton in our room. When we contacted the hotel we were told that we had to speak directly with the head of housekeeping, whom we were unable to make direct contact with for more that 4 days. Needless to say, I insisted on speaking to someone else at that point, only to be told that the items had not been logged as having been found in the room and that I had waited too long to call.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location- Spacious Rooms- Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Froglet
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in good location. Rooms are very spacious. Clean. Good value for money. Staff at reception friendly enough (slightly less that elsewhere in Eastern Canada where we took our vacation). Our first room on 7th floor was better than the one on 5th floor (noise -bath/shower???-coming from another room was pretty bad ). No microwave, no fridge unfortunately. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value and convenience in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: astarratt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada Plaza Toronto for one night last week while attending Cirque du Soleil and the Chinese Lantern Festival. Our stay was most enjoyable and we will definitely plan to stay there again on another occasion. Attractive features included the friendly and helpful front desk staff, convenient underground parking, large and clean room and a great and reasonably priced breakfast and efficient and cheerful service received in the morning. We also appreciated being able to leave our car for a few hours after check-out time without any additioned charges. The only negative for those in a hurry (which we weren't) that I can think of might be the small and rather slow elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service!”
Reviews.Author: DiamStar5
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Ramada Plaza on Jarvis in Toronto for a 2-night stay. We booked a package deal that included 2 tickets to the Blue Jays game. It said on the site that stay for 2 nights, get the 3rd night free. Well, when we called to see if we would be eligble for the 3rd night, they said that it really wasn't free, it just changed the price. NO WHERE ON THE SITE DID IT INDICATE THIS. Anyway, after a 4 hour long drive to Toronto, we get to the Ramada to be greeted with unfriendly service. Not only did we wait in a line for awhile only for the front desk to take another woman behind us first, the man was very rude and rushed with us. He seemed angry to serve young adults as he was pleasant with the older couple who were ahead of us. We had a junior suite on the 10th floor which was pretty nice. Later, when I asked for directions to the Eaton Centre, the same man at the front desk rolled his eyes and provided me with quick directions. The other staff at the desk were also rude and very unhelpful. The hotel have 2 elevators that are tiny and slow. After our first night, we went down to the hotel's restaurant, Shade, for our complimentary breakfast. There were 2 employees working the floor; one girl who only washed down the tables and a man who waitored. The man was very unfriendly with us and never refilled our so-called 'bottomless coffee' once. The food was not bad. Anyway, after the blue jays game, we returned to our room after the maid had cleaned. Everything appeared fine until I went into the bathroom. The toilet had an odd red ring inside of it and they had sprayed my expensive perfume in the bathroom. When we had first arrived, we noticed our ironing board was broken and thought it would have been replaced; it wasn't. We went down to the front desk to ask for one and the other man working rudely said we should have one in our room. We said we did but it was taken away because it was broken and he gave us a weird look and went to the computer and said it would be fixed. The ice box for the ENTIRE hotel was located on the lower level as opposed to every second level. Another thing, our windows in our hotel room were FILTHY and not properly cleaned. Lastly, upon check-out, the lady working the front desk that day was also unfriendly and gave us incorrect information which screwed up the ending of our trip. Overall, it was a nice hotel but if you are young, I would suggest against this hotel as they seem displeased to serve you. If that doesn't change your mind, maybe the scantily clad prostitues that stand close to the hotel nightly will.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Colourmetravel
Reviews.Content: In 2005 I was looking on line for a hotel close to Ryerson University as we were taking our son for an interview at the university. I came across the Ramada Plaza on Jarvis St. and realized how very close it was to Ryerson so we booked our accommodations. We were pleasantly surprised by the decor and size of of the rooms. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful and we never had to wait. The hotel was very clean, the rooms were comfortable and the rates were incredibly reasonable. We booked again in 2006 while on a business trip and stayed last week as well. We have booked accomadations for this coming Friday and look forward to our visit again to Toronto. This hotel offers everything you need and is a convenient walk to downtown shopping and entertainment. I believe this will be our hotel of choice during each and every visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Bring the table back”
Reviews.Author: vinny38
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here many years in a row and it's always great. The new showers and a/c are nice and the complimentary breakfast is a good idea, however their used to be a dinner table in the 2 king suite which is needed. Nonetheless, I will definately return to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, highly underrated”
Reviews.Author: caklaver
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and service We have stayed several times at this hotel and are always impressed by the service, the personal attention we receive and the convenience offered. The hotel is in a terrific location, close enough to walk to the Eatonâ€™s centre and many other attractions (the Elgin Theatre, etc.), yet very accessible. The parking is about the easiest to access in the downtown core - immediately off Jarvis Street, with a large driveway. The hotel itself has everything. One of my favourite aspects of the hotel is the variety of room types available. I took my daughter here for her 13th birthday party shopping trip with three friends. The two bedroom suite was perfect. I slept soundly in a king-size bed while the girls were a full livingroom away in their room. We had three tvâ€™s and I had peace and quiet. And the price was perfect! This is an unsung gem of a hotel with excellent amenities, a great breakfast menu and excellent prices. If you are travelling with children, this hotelâ€™s suites are well-sized and well-priced. Try the breakfast in the hotelâ€™s restaurant. Itâ€™s excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay at the Ramada Plaza Toronto”
Reviews.Author: life-is-a-highway55
Reviews.Content: I recently stated at the Ramada Plaza Hotel downtown Toronto. I was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were large, the service was excellent and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would recommend the Ramada to anyone. The location is great -close to great shopping. Parking is easy and convenient. I will be staying at the Ramada Plaza during my next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “just the right size”
Reviews.Author: wescoaster
Reviews.Content: Was here for one day, one night for a small meeting. The meeting room was the perfect size and adequately equipped. I found the front desk very eager and helpful with tourist information, amenities, and taxi call. The hotel room and towels/sheets were very clean. It was an inconvenience to use the phones because my pre-paid calling card with a 1-888 number (supposedl to be free locally) wouldn't work. It would be a great service to provide free local calls.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for larger families”
Reviews.Author: julie099
Reviews.Content: If you have a large family and would like to put your kids to bed in an another room, this is the perfect spot. Price is great. We had a 2 bed suite for 169.00. Parking was extra. Downtown a close walk away, you may pay for parking at hotel, however you can leave your car and just walk. Room equipped with mini fridge, 3 tv's. large bathroom with sink in different room than toilet and shower. This is the place if you need space, why cram into a regular room or pay for two rooms when you can all be together. Yes, late at night you will find prostitutes cruising the area. Lots of homeless in the area. We never felt intimated or harrassed. Pool and hot tub great. We usually had the whole place to ourself. Great roof top next to pool to hang out, have a smoke while watching the kids. Steam room is great. They also have a squash court and great fitness room with up to date machines. Close walk to grocery store to stock up on things, can even eat in. Room has table and chairs. (microwave too) We always pick stuff up at local grocery stores to save money on meals. If you want to have a romantic get away prehaps this is not the place. This is just great for larger familes, friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: easiliypleased
Reviews.Content: Six of us (three couples) came to stay at the Ramada Plaza for a three-night stay 8-11 July. What a pleasant surprise! I used to be a fligtht attendant and flew for 11 years...The Ramada Hotels had always been at the bottom of my list of comfortable hotels to stay in - I always thought "last choice" when I thought of Ramadas. Well, not in this case!! First of all, Michael, to whom I spoke by phone directly to make our reservations only a day before arriving, assured me that we would all receive king-bedded mini-suites when we arrivred, which we did. As a matter of fact, Michael was there when we checked in, too! What a gentleman! The rooms were super comfortable and very clean, with a small living room separated from the bedroom by a glass parlour door. Both of the rooms had a TV. The king bed and bedding was divine!!! The bathroom, though small, had the greatest tub and shower - super powerful shower and large tub! There were even two large terry robes in the closet for our use! I said, " Are we sure, this is a Ramada?" We had driven up from Illinois by van and were able to park it on premises and inside for $18 a day w/free in and out privileges. There was an onsite gym and pool that was just what my husband and I were looking for. The only downside of the stay was the restaurant - we never saw any patrons in there and when it was open (6-10AM and 6-10PM only) there was a funny odor when we stuck our heads in there to look around. No problem though - there were plenty of restaurants around the area as the location was ideal. If not for the restaurant (and at check-out the gentleman at the front desk was kind of icy w/zero personality--it was not Michael), we would give it an excellent rating. If you have any doubts or continue to scroll down past the Ramada, stop!!! You can bet we will return next year!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst!!”
Reviews.Author: roo32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada for one night during the summer of 2007. I had read that there were some renovations but that did not give the place the face lift it needs. Also there was some sort of construction happening at the hotel front. What we hated: 1) The astronomical cost of parking even though the hotel is not among the closest to downtown Toronto hot spots. And beware, there is a tax that is added to the original quote of parking. 2) A random energy surcharge on the overall bill 3) The poor quality of the towels, sheets, and other supplies. 4) The prostitutes that were propositioning people outside our hotel at 1am on Friday nights. This is no joke. One of them approached my boyfriend. 5)The inability of the front desk staff to order a taxi for guests of the hotels 6)The outdated, old furniture and carpeting. What helped to prevent a disastrous night: 1) The lobby area is quite well kept. 2)The housekeeping staff did their very best with the overused outdated rooms and the rooms were very clean. 3) The staff was kind enough to allow us a late checkout upon request. Overall this is not the place you go to for luxury and quality During the night the other guests were quite loud and we could barely sleep. After getting the final bill it saddened me that we didn't pick somewhere better. With all the extra taxes and charges the cost if about the same as a more reputable hotel. Try the Holiday INN ON KING or the Fairmont Royal York

Reviews.Title: “The Ramada Plaza's Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter43
Reviews.Content: What a find! Affordable, with spacious rooms appointed with everything you need for comfort, and quiet so sleeping's no problem. And the best of it is that all downtown Toronto's just a few steps away. When I cheked out the first time I immediately rebooked for my return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Stay, Ramada”
Reviews.Author: RunnerOttawa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-situated in the heart of Toronto. Recently redecorated rooms are very comfortable. The restaurant is quiet and the food is surprisingly good. Staying in for dinner is a nice option at the end of a long day. Given the price point of the Ramada, it is a very good bargain.

Reviews.Title: “I Always Return To The Ramada Plaza ”
Reviews.Author: retiredbob
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ramada Plaza Toronto three times in the last year. The hotel is centrally located for the things I want to enjoy while vacationing in the city. The rooms are very clean and room, as well as affordable. This is the only place I will stay when I visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ramada Plaza Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Rball66
Reviews.Content: The Ramada Plaza Toronto was the best hotel I have stayed at in a long time. Very clean, Very Friendly. Rooms were spacious and Decorated nicely. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: khaines01
Reviews.Content: My 2 night stay at the Ramada in early June 07'was great. I was in Toronto to attend a conference and parked my car on site. Had a very comfortable room, upgraded from the original booking! Wonderful, and I'll do it again!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trav-london
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights on holiday in Toronto. Staff were not especially friendly at check in, but warmed up as the stay went on thankfully. Actually they turned out to be some of the politer people we met in Toronto so I am not complaining. Room was modern & clean as you would expect. Lifts from the 10th floor could be annoying slow at peak times (i.e. stopping every floor). The restaurant/breakfast room is drab and uninspiring, with poor natural light. I had breakfast there once and did not return. The fitness room is well equipped, but the pool is on the small side. Be careful in this part of Toronto - we discovered half way through our stay from reading the Lonely Planet that it is not safe in the area around the hotel after dark. The area around Allen Gardens (directly across the road from the hotel) is singled out as the worst area! We did experience this one evening when we returned our hire car at the depot a few blocks away and walked back - it was not a pleasant experience at all and we were approached several times by some unsavoury characters. If you are going out at night - get taxis there and back!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MrPanther
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Ramada Plaza often when in Toronto on business. The location , for us, is excellent. It is close (easy walking distance) to our business destinations and the many delights of the City. But the features we like best are: > It is acrross the street from a lovely park -where we can walk, sit, enjoy the atmosphere and relax after a hard day. > The staff are friendly, efficient, and accomodationg -and they remember us by name & make us feel most welcome and at home away from home. > The rooms are comfortable, spacious, airy and well appointed. The Hotel has recently undergone a renovation, and the facilities are great. > The dining room has a good selection, the food is A1, and the main waiter/cook/chief bottle washer & maitre D (who we have known for some time now) is excellent. > Parking is easy, with in-out privilages at no extra cost. >The service is overall, of very high quality. > Rates are great (quite low in comparison to other hotels in the vacinity).Rates in Toronto are very high -this hotel is an exception. Danielle and Murray

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: bjack
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at Ramada Plaza Toronto extremely helpful. The hotel is very well placed for city sights. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good. I would definately head for the Ramada Plaza again when I come to Toronto.
